column1: Men are like chocolate bars. sweet smooth and they usually head right for your hips.
column3: The word hips refers to parts of the body, but in the context of the joke, it also implies where people usually carry weight (figuratively speaking).
column4: The doctor examined the patients hips to determine if there was any joint pain.
column5: She was concerned about her hips after indulging in holiday treats.

column1: What dont elephants forget when they go swimming? their trunks.
column3: The word trunks refers to either the large, elongated noses of elephants or to a type of swimming shorts.
column4: The elephant splashed playfully in the water, using its trunk to spray water all around.
column5: He packed his shorts into the suitcase, making sure to include his favorite swimming trunks.

column1: How does a german get to the airport? he heils a taxi!
column3: The word heils refers to a German greeting associated with Heil and is used humorously here in relation to hailing a taxi.
column4: The soldiers in the movie were seen greeting their leaders with a loud Heil.
column5: I hail a taxi when I am in a hurry to get somewhere important.

column1: What is a dentists favorite musical instrument? a tuba toothpaste.
column3: The word tube refers to a container for toothpaste and the shape of a tuba instrument.
column4: The dentist handed me a tube of toothpaste to help with my dental care.
column5: The tuba player practiced his scales until he felt confident about the performance.

column1: Why cant ewoks yell in the house? because they have to use their endor voices.
column3: The word Endor is the name of a forested planet in the Star Wars universe, while in the joke context, it hints at the word indoor.
column4: The characters in the film ventured to the moon of Endor to participate in the epic battle.
column5: We decided to have a movie night indoors because of the rainy weather.
